Notes: Celebrating its 30th year the MEE is the largest environmental education event for students in Canada. Taking place in downtown Calgary the MEE hosts over 79 workshops and performances by 19 performers and or organizations. The MEE also has over 80 interactive environmentally theme booths from both community organizations and student lead environmental projects. The Expo is held over 3 days Tuesday to Thursday for students from across Calgary and surrounding areas and is open to the public all three days. The Mayor's Environment Expo is the largest environmental education exposition in Canada. The Expo also hosts the annual Jack Leslie Award and the annual youth environmental photo contest. Both of these events take place the Thursday before the annual Mayor's Environment Expo.
Title: The Mayor's Environment Expo

Notes: Opening Ceremonies is an annual event hosted by the City of Calgary and Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal committee members from the community.  The event is the kick-off to Aboriginal Awareness Week in Calgary.  The Mayor officially declares Aboriginal Awareness Week in a noon hour event at Olympic Plaza.  The event includes the official proclamation by the Mayor or representative, presentations, and entertainment.  A video montage is being developed and will be featured at the event with photos from last years, interviews from previous years attendees and interviews on leadership. Lunch will be served to attendees free of charge.
Title: Aboriginal Awareness Week Calgary Opening Ceremonies AAWOC

Notes: Franco Festival Calgary FFC, a Francophone Multicultural Event. FFC is a celebration of many diverse Francophone cultures Africa, North- America, South-America, Asia and Europe through dance, music, food, arts  crafts showcasing arts and cultures of the diverse French-speaking communities of Calgary and its surrounding communities. This is a family event with activities for all ages and all nations! Dance to live music and dance performances by local and national artists, as well as this year's event includes a multi-arts pavilion run by local craftsmen and artists, children's area, workshops, a bistro beer garden and food vendors.
Title: Franco Festival Calgary 2019

Notes: A large annual charity fundraiser during Stampede in an outdoor music festival format featuring performances from world renowned artists. This event runs from 3:00 PM to 11:00 PM, is open to the general public, 18 years of age and older, who must purchase tickets in order to attend.  Admission includes entry into the site, performances from 3 internationally acclaimed recording artists, the ability to purchase a variety of food options and entrance into an official off-site after party.  A portion of the proceeds will be donated to the Canadian Armed Forces recognized charity, the Calgary chapter of the Military Family Resource Centre MFRC, who provide programs and services of prevention, support and intervention services with focus on mental health, family separation and reunification support, counselling and crisis intervention.
Title: Oxford Stomp

Host Organization: Pakistan Punjabi Culture Council Of North America
Notes: Pakistan Punjabi Culture Council Of North America PPCNA to celebrate and honor all mothers of the world on Mother¿s Day, thanking them for their efforts in giving us life, raising us and being our constant supporter. Today Mother's Day is celebrated in several countries including US, UK, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Denmark, Finland, Italy, Turkey, Australia, Mexico, Canada, China, Japan, and Belgium. People take the day as an opportunity to pay tribute to their mothers and thank them for all their love and support. The day has become hugely popular and in several countries, phone lines witness maximum traffic. There is also a tradition of gifting flowers, cards and others gift to mothers on the Mother's Day. Our Event aims at building new bridges among different cultures and communities where all are welcome regardless of race, background gender or religion and honor all women belonging different countries and cultures.
Title: Annual South Asian Mother's Day Celebration

Notes: Disability Pride will be a celebration of people with disabilities. It will be a day of community and inclusion where the attendees will walk, wheel, and ride down 8th avenue and 7th Street SW  together to Olympic Plaza. At Olympic Plaza there will be food, music and several tents set-up with information on disabilities and programs for disabilities.
Title: Disability Pride 2019

Notes: For more than 33 years, Aga Khan Foundation Canada AKFC has worked with Canada and Canadians to sustainably improve the quality of life of poor, marginalized communities in Asia and Africa. In addition to the Walk being a fund-raising event, it is also a way to bring Calgarians together to gain an understanding of the Aga Khan Foundation Canada AKFC and their impact in the developing world. The Walk provides a fun and transformative venue for families. They enjoy a day in the park filled with food, entertainment and joy and they are also given an opportunity to learn about Canada's role in alleviating global poverty. The Walk gives Calgarians a chance to be a Global Citizens.
Title: Aga Khan Foundation Canada - World Partnership Walk

Notes: Outdoor festival celebration of and education about vegan living in Calgary key components: beer gardens, speakers, music, vendors, family friendly.
Title: VegFest Calgary

Notes: Sporting Life 10km is Calgary's Fastest 10km road running race hosted by the Calgary Marathon Society CMS. In its second year the event hosted over 1000 runners on the unique net downhill point to point road race. With this being the City's Fastest race over this distance and the course very attainable in nature. Over it will be accessible to many different types of runners with different goals and objectives. The objective of the event is to encourage runners to be competitive with themselves and improve on their running achievements for all abilities and fitness levels and grow the sport of running in Calgary and make it more accessible through an entry level distance race.
Title: Sporting Life 10km

Notes: Country Thunder Alberta is a 3-day music festival held at Prairie Winds Park. Going into its 4th year the festival features the biggest names in Country Music. This year's headliner will be Jason Aldean and with more to be announced in the upcoming months.  Previous performers have included Tim McGraw, Luke Bryan and Eric Church. The B-stage will host Alberta's up and coming country music artists. In addition to music there is 20 plus food, retail and sponsor booths on site to keep patron busy onsite. Country Thunder Alberta is the part of the Country Thunder Music Festivals that has festivals in Saskatchewan, Wisconsin, Florida and Arizona.
Title: Country Thunder Alberta

Notes: March for Jesus brings Christians of every tradition, age, and color, into the streets to celebrate what Jesus has done and to ask God's blessing on our cities. It is nothing more and nothing less than a joyous celebration of our Lord Jesus Christ.  Everyone is welcome to attend.  March for Jesus is a heartfelt praise for Jesus and prayer for cities and nations. It is also a way to celebrate our Heavenly Father at Fathers Day! March for Jesus will start at the Millennium Park gathering place at 1 pm, then together at 2 pm we will then march down 8th Avenue SW to Olympic Plaza. The march will finish around 4:30 pm with a celebration, music, dances, preaching, prayers, feeding the poor, singing and drama. The celebration of our Christian faith will end 10 pm.
Title: March for Jesus

Notes: Fundraiser.  Participants hike around Princes Island Park using pathways. Pledge forms completed ahead of time. Registration and Hike begins and ends at the stage area.

Notes: The Indigenous Day Live concert is Canada¿s biggest celebration of National Indigenous Day June 21 and the vehicle that captures all of this amazingly diverse talent and shares it with all Canadians. This live six-hour concert, along with a 6 x 30 minute best-of series, spotlights all the music, dance, comedy and art of First Nations, Inuit and Metis Peoples.
Title: Indigenous Day Live 2019 Inc.

Notes: On June 20, 2019 Arts Commons will celebrate the contribution of Canada's Indigenous Peoples with a mini Pow Wow out front of Arts Commons on 8th Ave SE 11:30am to 1:30pm. This event is indigenous led, and supported by the programming, production and front of house teams of Arts Commons, Indigenous programmers and advisers will gather dances from across the Treaty 7 nations to perform various styles of dance. The event will begin with a land acknowledgment and prayer by an elder, and end with an inter-tribal dance where the public can participate. This event is family-friendly, free, and open to all abilities.
Title: Arts Commons Mini Pow Wow

Notes: The People¿s Gathering honours the many diverse Indigenous cultures in Canada, including the Metis, Inuit and First Nations during Aboriginal Awareness Week.  Opening with a traditional Grand Entry, the event offers rich cultural experiences including traditional drumming and dancing.  The event is a celebration of community and neighbourhood spirit.
Title: The People's Gathering

Notes: The Festival of The Chariots originated thousands of years ago in Jagannatha Puri in Orissa in India and celebrated in major towns across India. The carved and colorfully-painted chariots, liberally bedecked with flowers and garlands, are accompanied by enthusiastic congregational chanting, singing, and dancing by tens of hundreds of devotees. After the procession, there is a large free feast of Krishna vegetarian food for all participants and visitors. The intent is to bring peace and happiness in everyone¿s life. In the Western world, the event took place 50 years ago, in 1967, in San Francisco. Apart from dozens of cities across the United States, it has been held in over 60 countries. In Calgary, we have been organizing this event for the last 14 years and this will be our 15th year of Rath Yatra Festival of Chariots, which will be held on July 20th, 2019
Title: Festival of Chariots

Notes: The primary mandate of the CCC is to showcase Caribbean arts and culture within the Calgary context. To advocate and promote the unique Caribbean culture for the benefit of the Calgary arts Community. The Council was incorporated under the Alberta Societies Act in 1981 and has grown to be the largest Caribbean festival in Western Canada.
Title: Carifest 2019

Notes: This urban bike ride draws together the various elements of the cycling community: race, recreation commuter, bmx, road and mountain. This is a unique event the public can join to cycle on roads that are inaccessible because of traffic. Our goal is to promote cycling, road safety and the professional bicycle racing. The spoke rides start in mid-morning bringing participants from north and south to a park rendezvous. The main Hub Ride is a slower paced ride departing at approximately noon, which children are encouraged to cycle. The smallest children have a shorter children's ride along the Elbow River Pathway. The event highlights the benefits of cycling and an active lifestyle.
Title: Ride the Road Tour

Title: Paws in the Park 2019

Notes: This is an annual summer family event in memory of all those impacted by the atomic bombs of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, and in solidarity toward a peaceful world free from nuclear weapons. With the launching of floating lanterns on the pool, symbols of peace and hope, and singing, drumming, a children's drama, and speeches, Calgarians are inspired to help build a more united, peaceful and safe world, free from nuclear weapons. This initiative models and promotes the principles involved in human rights, as a critical basis for building a peaceful global community. The organizing committee, invited speakers and performers, all from diverse ethnic and faith communities, are evidence of this. This event helps people, children and youth alike, to become aware of and empowered by the core values of human rights: mutual respect and cooperation.
Title: Floating Lantern Peace Ceremony 2019

New to Golf? Feeling a little intimidated? Come out for our very popular Beginner Nights and golf in a fun, relaxed atmosphere with others of the same ability. Green fees include: 9 holes, giveaways, game and etiquette tips and a Golf Pro who will offer free golf tips on selected evenings (only from 5:00pm – 7:00pm). Ages: 18 Years and up.

Four day advanced tee times recommended. Visit calgary.ca/golf or call 403-221-3510
Title: Beginner Golf Nights

Notes: Nations Cup provides a unique opportunity for players to participate in a Calgary version of the World Cup by forming teams based on their ethnic backgrounds and countries of origin, creating an exciting atmosphere that provides a stage for people throughout the community to express pride in their heritage. It is an opportunity to recognize the cultural diversity that exists locally within the sport of soccer.
Title: Calgary's Nations Cup 2019

Notes: Calgary jerk festival our vision is a three tier process. we classify our festival as a multicultural event under the jam rock music festival name. one of our goals is to bring local art and music to the main stage we think Calgary there is a lack of exposure. our small business need help in our community with this festival we help them to showcase their product. As a group we have realized that there seem to be a separation of families and cultures in our community. with our festival we are hoping to bring all cultures together.
Title: Jamrock music festival

Notes: Traditional cultural festival including performances, food, market, kids fair etc
Title: Calgary Japanese festival - Omatsuri

Notes: This annual event invites people of all ages to join us for a walk in the inner city and stop at 14 stations to reflect on the suffering, passion and death of our Lord, Jesus Christ through scripture readings, songs and meditative silence.
Title: 36th Annual Outdoor Way of the Cross

Notes: A fundraising run/walk for you and your four legged friend.

Host Organization: Otafest Film  Cultural Festival Planning Committee
Notes: Otafest is Calgary's Anime Festival! We are a not for profit organization with a mission to celebrate and promote Asian popular arts including anime animation, manga comic books, cosplay costumes! Otafest 2019 will be our 21st festival. We are hoping to use the 100E block of Stephen Avenue to do a night festival as part of Otafest 2019!
Title: Otafest 2019

Notes: Food trucks, music, beer, entertainment.
Title: YYCFT Frenzy

Notes: Rhubarb Fest is a community festival that takes place in southwest Calgary the community of Southwood and reaches out to all surrounding community and residents. The event includes: kid bouncers, petting zoo, face paint market place, vendors, City departments, organizations, live music, entertainment for children, beer gardens, BBQ, skate park, and more. The event is free to attend. There are some items that cost money: vendor products, BBQ food, rhubarb pie and beer. The goal of this event is to b street festival feel to communities further south in Calgary. Similar in some degree to things like Lilac Festival or Sunfest but currently on a smaller We bring this form of entertainment to communities outside of the Core don't have Business Revitalization Zones. A family friendly event that is accessible to those that may be challenged financially to attend other for entertainment.
Title: Rhubarb Fest

Notes: 5KM Family Fun Walk in support of the mental health and emotional well-being of young people in Canada. The event also includes a family fun area, entertainment, free participant lunch, giveaways and more prior to the walk taking place.
Title: 2019 Walk So Kids Can Talk
Sport Chek Mother Day Run, Walk  Ride

Host Organization: Spina Bifida  Hydrocephalus Association of Souther
Notes: The Hope Classic Run, Walk, Wheel is a family-friendly, non-competitive, Canada-wide event. Participants of all abilities walk, wheel, or run through a 1 km, 5 km or 10 km paved course.
Title: Hope Classic

Notes: The Gutsy Walk takes place on Sunday, June 2, 2019 at over 60 locations across Canada. Every walk is fun-filled, family-friendly, and non-competitive. Route lengths vary, but are typically five kilometers. Participants can walk any distance they're comfortable with.  This is Canada's largest community fundraiser for Crohn's and colitis. Since 1996, the Gutsy Walk has raised over $38 million for research and patient programs, all thanks to participants, donors, and sponsors who are driven to make a difference.  The Calgary walk will take place at the North Edworthy Park. Lunch will be provided for all registrants. All dogs on leash are allowed to participate. Lots of activities for kids this year including face painting, bean toss and other games.
Title: Gutsy Walk
SPC on Planning and Urban Development

Notes:
This is a great opportunity for children 6-12 years old to be introduced to a new sport – and it’s free!

Registration begins in May for this exciting one day event. For more information and to register, see www.allsportoneday.ca.

All Sport One Day is taking place at the following locations:

  • Calgary Soccer Centre
  • Glenmore Athletic Park
  • Max Bell Centre
  • Renfrew Complex
  • Southland Leisure Centre
  • Village Square Leisure Centre
